page.title: 12Inverarity School Day
page.content: On a school day I am up at half past seven and have had my breakfast and have dressed by eight o'clock.Most of the pupils are at school by ten to nine.At nine o'clock Mr Forbes, the headteacher, blows his whistle to line us up outside and each class goes in.Each teacher asks their class who is going to dinners and who is going to packed lunches.Once this is done we begin our lessons.At half past ten there is an interval and we go outside for half an hour.When we go in we continue with lessons.At half past twelve we go to the dinner hall for lunch and then we go outside.At quarter to two we get called in and do lessons or project work.At half past three we go home by bus.
